item.title: HttpPost Problem
item.dc:creator: @John459 John459
item.description:
@John459 wrote:

[quote=“Miss Silabsoft, post:13, topic:368795”][quote author=John459 link=topic=464929.msg3400556#msg3400556 date=1289871369]

[quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=464929.msg3400399#msg3400399 date=1289863577]

Use your own SQLite database?

Would not work for this because this will be overall highscores for everyone playing the game. I think Davidi2 gave the correct solution anyways.

EDIT: Davidi2’s method did not work.
[/quote]It should have worked. Actually, like I said on the IRC, there might’ve been a small error. Do what silabsoft posted and encode the rest of the string too.

But she is right, anyone that knows how your program works can insert their own data.

I suppose I could send another string and have php file check to see it exists, and if it doesn’t then nothing will be sent.
[/quote]That would help safety a little bit, but anyone that can get the source code would be able to easily take advantage of that. (I don’t know how apps work in that sense)

No one will be able to get the code for the app do not worry about that.

Pretty sure android has proxy capabilities.[/quote]

Pretty sure this is the only way to access a mysql database. Also, the average person will not know how to and others probably won’t care much.

Read full topic

item.title: HttpPost Problem
item.dc:creator: @silabsoft RuneAgent
item.description:
@silabsoft wrote:

/**
 *
 * @author Silabsoft
 */
public class Main {

    public Main() {
        System.out.println("The flaw with using this method");
    }

    public void post(String n, Integer s) throws Exception {
        String data = URLEncoder.encode("name", "UTF-8") + "=" + URLEncoder.encode(n, "UTF-8");
        data += "&" + URLEncoder.encode("score", "UTF-8") + "=" + URLEncoder.encode(s.toString(), "UTF-8");
        HttpURLConnection conn = (HttpURLConnection) new URL("http://amazing-apps.com/post.php").openConnection();
        conn.setRequestMethod("POST");
        conn.setDoOutput(true);
        OutputStreamWriter wr = new OutputStreamWriter(conn.getOutputStream());
        wr.write(data);
        wr.flush();
        wr.close();

    }

    public static void main(String args[]) {
        Main m = new Main();
        for (int i = 0; i < 9001; i++) {
            try {
                m.post("Silabsoft_" + i, 1000 * i);   
            } catch (Exception ex) {
                ex.printStackTrace();
            }
        }
    }
}

Read full topic

item.title: HttpPost Problem
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

public void post(String n, String s) throws Exception { HttpURLConnection http = (HttpURLConnection) new URL("http://amazing-apps.com/post.php").openConnection(); http.setRequestMethod("POST"); http.setDoOutput(true); DataOutputStream out = new DataOutputStream(http.getOutputStream()); String content = "name=" + URLEncoder.encode(n, "UTF-8") + "&score=" + URLEncoder.encode(s, "UTF-8") ; out.writeBytes(content); out.flush(); out.close(); }

item.title: HttpPost Problem
item.dc:creator: @John459 John459
item.description:
@John459 wrote:

I’m trying to send data to a mysql database with java. To do this I am using HttpPost to execute a php file to post the information to the database. The problem is nothing is being sent to the php file so nothing to being added to the sql database.

Here is what I’m currently using:

private void useSql(String n, String s) throws ClientProtocolException, IOException { ArrayList<NameValuePair> inp = new ArrayList<NameValuePair>(); inp.add(new BasicNameValuePair("name",n)); inp.add(new BasicNameValuePair("score",s)); HttpClient httpclient = new DefaultHttpClient(); HttpPost httppost = new HttpPost("http://amazing-apps.com/post.php"); httppost.setEntity(new UrlEncodedFormEntity(inp)); httpclient.execute(httppost); }

Read full topic
